summary: This is a FinCEN FBAR (Foreign Bank Account Report) transcript for Ghislaine Maxwell for the 2018 calendar year, filed in October 2019. It details five foreign financial accounts held in the UK, primarily with Barclays, with a combined maximum value exceeding $2.9 million. The document was prepared by a third-party accounting firm.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The individual filing the FBAR report, disclosing ownership/authority over five foreign financial accounts in the United Kingdom for the 2018 calendar year.

persons.name: Laura K Barooshian
persons.context: The preparer who signed and submitted the FBAR report on behalf of Ghislaine Maxwell through the firm Dicicco, Gulman & Company, LLP.

connections.description: Barooshian, as a third-party preparer from an accounting firm, prepared and filed Maxwell's mandatory FBAR financial disclosure to the U.S. Treasury.

events.title: FBAR Reporting Period
events.description: The calendar year for which Ghislaine Maxwell was required to report her foreign financial accounts to the U.S. Treasury.

events.title: FBAR Filing
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell, via a third-party preparer, filed her FBAR report disclosing five foreign financial accounts for 2018.

locations: Liverpool, L2 5RH, GB (Wealth at Work Limited address)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell filed an FBAR in October 2019, disclosing five foreign financial accounts for the 2018 tax year.
The accounts were held primarily at Barclays in London, with one pension account at Wealth at Work Limited in Liverpool.
The maximum aggregate value across all five accounts during 2018 was approximately $2,990,096.
The filing was prepared and submitted electronically by a third-party accounting firm, Dicicco, Gulman & Company, LLP, based in Woburn, Massachusetts.
The document is a U.S. Treasury record collected under the Bank Secrecy Act, indicating ongoing financial scrutiny of Maxwell's assets.
